Study Details:
Study Type: subchronic
Species: male Wistar rats
Mode of Administration: inhalation
(whole body exposure chambers)
Exposure Regime: a control group
and 3 exposure groups: 1) m-xylene
concentrations of 50 ppm (217 mg/m3)
and 100 ppm (435 mg/m3), or
2) n-butyl alcohol 50 ppm (154 mg/m3)
and 100 ppm (308 mg/m3), or 3) a
1:1 mixture of m-xylene and n-butyl
alcohol (100 ppm [217 mg/m3 m-xylene +
154 mg/m3 of n-butyl alcohol] and
200 ppm [435 mg/m3 m-xylene +
308 mg/m3 of n-butyl alcohol]),
6 hours/day, 5 days/week
Duration: 3 months
Uncertainty Factors: 75 (10 for
intraspecies variability, 2.5 for
interspecies variability, and 3 for
use of a subchronic study)
TRV Derivation Method:
PBPK modeling to
estimate internal rat blood
concentration corresponding
to NOAEL of
50 ppm =
0.138 mg/L
+
Conversion to external oral
human dose using human
PBPK model and assuming
ingestion of 1.5 L drinking
water/day
NOAEL =
HEC
1.0 mg/kg -day
BW
TDI = NOAEL /UF
HEC
Carcinogenicity Classification:
CEPA: Group IV
unlikely to be
carcinogenic
to humans
(EC and HC, 1993h)
IARC: Group 3
not classifiable as to
its carcinogenicity
to humans
(IARC, 1999a)
US EPA IRIS:
inadequate
information to
assess carcinogenic
potential (US EPA,
2003b)

Study Details:
Study Type: subchronic
Species: male Wistar rats
Mode of Administration: inhalation
(whole body exposure chambers)
Exposure Regime: a control group
and 3 exposure groups: 1) m-xylene
concentrations of 50 ppm (217 mg/m3)
and 100 ppm (435 mg/m3), or
2) n-butyl alcohol 50 ppm (154 mg/m3)
and 100 ppm (308 mg/m3), or 3) a
1:1 mixture of m-xylene and n-butyl
alcohol (100 ppm [217 mg/m3 m-xylene +
154 mg/m3 of n-butyl alcohol] and
200 ppm [435 mg/m3 m-xylene +
308 mg/m3 of n-butyl alcohol]),
6 hours/day, 5 days/week
Duration: 3 months
Uncertainty Factors: 300 (10 for
intraspecies human variability, 3 for
interspecies variability, 3 for extrapolation
from subchronic to chronic duration,
and 3 for database uncertainties)
TRV Derivation Method:
NOAEL adjusted for
continuous exposure and
difference in blood/gas
partitioning in rats
vs humans
NOAEL = 39 mg/m3
HEC
TC = NOAEL /UF
HEC
Source:
HC, 2018a
(based on
US EPA, 2003b
[derived from
Korsak et al.,
1994])
